channel.title: Wierd portforwarding issue
channel.description:
okay i have a really weird port forwarding issue, I'm using a Cisco DPC3825 router and i just switched to rogers internet. I know how to port forward but for some reason it is not working before i was doing it wrong and on http://www.canyouseeme.org/ i was getting connection timed out but now i am getting connection refused. here is a screenshot of my router settings i am 99% sure everything is right.
Also something that may be important my moms work uses phones through the internet and they set up a phone at my house so there is actually an extra router not sure if it matters but i think that's why you see port 443. I'm maybe thinking i have to port forward both routers? anyway here is the screen shot
[img]http://img692.imageshack.us/img692/5312/unledix.png[/img]
PS: Sorry if there is any spelling mistakes i wanted to get an answer quick.

item.title: Wierd portforwarding issue
item.dc:creator: @XxHawkxX XxHawkxX
item.description:
@XxHawkxX wrote:

it’s all good now i got a friend to teamview. Thanks for your help everybody.

Read full topic

item.title: Wierd portforwarding issue
item.dc:creator: @Honnee18 Honnee18
item.description:
@Honnee18 wrote:

[quote=“XxHawkxX, post:5, topic:408648”][quote author=xXxSkillerxXx link=topic=509930.msg3700125#msg3700125 date=1312690914]
is your source still listening to the same port as before and or ip address if you had changed it.?
[/quote]

sorry i don’t understand this?[/quote]

His asking if you have changed you’re ip through ur server files. Cause it’s not needed.

Read full topic
